intro: Stipecoma mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, and it produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. Stipecoma mucronata is often found in coastal fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
